channel.title: Scary stuff
channel.description:
Has anyone tried listening to this? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JNJJ-QkZ8cM while listening to that but reading this? http://www.creepypastaindex.com/creepypasta/the-skype-call or http://www.creepypastaindex.com/creepypasta/noend-house or http://www.creepypastaindex.com/creepypasta/gateway-of-the-mind or http://www.creepypastaindex.com/creepypasta/psychosis
Pick one and tell me what you feel afterwards My friend said it was scary as hell but i didn't feel it was all that

item.title: Scary stuff
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Except for the 3rd one, I’ve already read them all. The psychosis one’s ending was pretty bad… I was expecting something better tbh.

item.title: Scary stuff
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:30, topic:437587”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=540292.msg3959233#msg3959233 date=1333112886]
I don’t get how the music would go with the story, I love all the old Pokemon music, this was one of my favorite songs. Relaxing.
[/quote]
I dunno either but this music was supposed to be creepy and eerie[/quote]
Sad that everyone makes up a story like that cause of some creepy music, that’s what made the town fun to be in and the game fun to play, made the hair on my arms go up as a kid and made it more fun then just staring at a 3 inch screen for 5+ hours collecting virtual items.

Read full topic

item.title: Scary stuff
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:27, topic:437587”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=540292.msg3959040#msg3959040 date=1333075300]

If you want scary stuff, just watch ‘The Butterfly Effect’
You will shit your pants. And not be able to sleep at night…

Already saw both movies, not that scary but damn good movie

theres 3 of them.

Ik its not ‘Scary’ like most people imagine things jumping out at you, and blood and guts.
Its more of a psychological movie. Really gets you to think about things. Tbh scares the crap out of me when i think about what it means.

Gotto go watch 3 then
[/quote]

Only saw the first one. Is Ashton Kutcher in the other 2?[/quote]

No he’s not. And the first one was the only one worth watching, honestly.

Read full topic

item.title: Scary stuff
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Creepypasta – 10 Apr 13

NoEnd House | Creepypasta

Let me start off by saying that Peter Terry was addicted to heroin. We were friends in college and continued to be after I graduated. Notice that I said “I”. He dropped out after 2 years of barely cutting it. After I moved out of the dorms and into a...

damn this ^one was amazing.
a must read

Room 9 was hell. And then it happened. A light. One of those stereotypical lights at the end of the tunnel. Then I felt ground come up from below me, and I was standing. After a moment or two of gathering my thoughts and senses, I slowly walked toward that light.

As I approached the light, it took form. It was a vertical slit down the side of a door, this time unmarked. I slowly walked through the door and found myself back where I started, the lobby of NoEnd House. It was exactly how I left it. Still empty, still decorated with childish Halloween decorations. After everything that had happened that night, I was still wary of where I was. After a few moments of normalcy, I looked around the place trying to find anything different. On the desk was a plain white envelope with my name handwritten on it. Immensely curious, yet still cautious, I mustered up the courage to open the envelope. Inside was a letter, again handwritten.

David Williams,

Congratulations! You have made it to the end of NoEnd House! Please accept this prize as a token of your great achievement.

Yours forever,
Management

With the letter was five $100 bills.

I couldn’t stop laughing. I laughed for what seemed like hours. I laughed as I walked out to my car and laughed as I drove home. I laughed as I pulled into my driveway, and laughed as I opened my front door to my house and laughed as I saw the small 10 etched into the wood.

Read full topic
